answers.answer: Hi!Well, your symptoms can be due to lupus since there is a family history, but history of repeated infection along with body aches can be due to anemia, low white blood cell count or diabetes. Hence these need to be ruled out first.Other than this hypothyroidism, UTI, and IBS should be ruled out. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!

question: im 32 and for weeks now have me suffering from body aches and  feeling lightheaded , i also keep getting infections , chest, ear ect which take month to clear up , my mother has lupus and im worried i may have the same
title: body aches and lightheaded
